    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    initialize method which sets initial values and state of buttons and charts, catches an exception in creating new windows of income/expenses/settings, in showing charts showChart(int, int), in updating balance updateBalance()
    protected void
    onBottomDayButtonClick()
    onBottomDayButtonClick method which shows a day chart of expenses/income (depending on currentOperationType) with the help of class ControllerFinals.DAY_CHART
    protected void
    onBottomMonthButtonClick()
    onBottomMonthButtonClick method which shows a Month chart of expenses/income (depending on currentOperationType) with the help of class ControllerFinals.MONTH_CHART

    onBottomWeekButtonClick()
    onBottomWeekButtonClick method which shows a Week chart of expenses/income (depending on currentOperationType) with the help of class ControllerFinals.WEEK_CHART

    onBottomYearButtonClick()
    onBottomYearButtonClick method which shows a Year chart of expenses/income (depending on currentOperationType) with the help of class ControllerFinals.YEAR_CHART
    protected void
    onExpensesButtonClick()
    onExpensesButtonClick method which shows the expenses windows through class OperationView with the help of method OperationView.show()
    protected void
    onExpensesChartButtonClick()
    onExpensesChartButtonClick method which shows different charts (depending on currentChartType) of your expenses (chooses OperationType with the help of class ControllerFinals.EXPENSES
    protected void
    onIncomeButtonClick()
    onIncomeButtonClick method which shows the income windows through class OperationView with the help of method OperationView.show()
    protected void
    onIncomeChartButtonClick()
    onIncomeChartButtonClick method which shows different charts (depending on currentChartType) of your Income (chooses OperationType with the help of class ControllerFinals.INCOME
    protected void
    onSettingsButtonClick()
    onSettingsButtonClick method which shows the settings windows through class SettingsView with the help of method SettingsView.show()
    void
    showChart(int operationType, int chartType)
    showChart method which chooses day/week/month/year chart to show depending on chartType of expenses/income depending on operationType and shows charts with the help of showDayChart(int) method and showWMYChart(int, int)
    private void
    showDayChart(int type)
    showDayChart method which sets the style of your day chart and shows it and at the end updates list updateList()
    private void
    showWMYChart(int operationType, int chartType)
    showWMYChart method which sets the table with the information about date, category and price of your income/expenses, sets the date depending on the type of chart and names this chart, adds all the categories on chart, groups records into categories and places them on a chart with a specific date, sets the style of your chart and update list updateList()
    void
    updateBalance()
    updateBalance method which updates your currency balance with the help of methods FinanceControlModel.getBalance() and FinanceControlModel.getCurrencyState()
    private void
    updateList()
    updateList method which clears the OperationList view and updates it to its initial state

    • showChart

      public void showChart(int operationType, int chartType) throws SQLException
      showChart method which chooses day/week/month/year chart to show depending on chartType of expenses/income depending on operationType and shows charts with the help of showDayChart(int) method and showWMYChart(int, int)
      Parameters:
      operationType - a type of your operation (0 if expenses, 1 if income)
      chartType - a type of your chart (0 if DAY_CHART, 1 if WEEK_CHART, 2 if MONTH_CHART, 3 if YEAR_CHART)
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is error connected with a database access

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      initialize method which sets initial values and state of buttons and charts, catches an exception in creating new windows of income/expenses/settings, in showing charts showChart(int, int), in updating balance updateBalance()
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - a URL variable
      resourceBundle - a ResourceBundle variable

    • showDayChart

      private void showDayChart(int type) throws SQLException
      showDayChart method which sets the style of your day chart and shows it and at the end updates list updateList()
      Parameters:
      type - defines the type of your day chart (o is expenses, 1 is income)
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is error connected with a database access

    • showWMYChart

      private void showWMYChart(int operationType, int chartType) throws SQLException
      showWMYChart method which sets the table with the information about date, category and price of your income/expenses, sets the date depending on the type of chart and names this chart, adds all the categories on chart, groups records into categories and places them on a chart with a specific date, sets the style of your chart and update list updateList()
      Parameters:
      operationType - defines the type of your chart (0 is expenses, 1 is income)
      chartType - defines the type of your chart (1 if WEEK_CHART, 2 if MONTH_CHART, 3 if YEAR_CHART)
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is error connected with a database access

    • groupItems

      private ArrayList<javafx.scene.chart.PieChart.Data> groupItems(List<OperationItem> list)
      groupItems method which reads values from OperationItem and returns an arraylist of categories with their appropriate sums
      Parameters:
      list - is the List OperationItem type object which contains the group ExpensesItem and IncomeItem
      Returns:
      returnList of the ArrayList PieChart.Data type with an information from your expenses/income table

    • updateBalance

      public void updateBalance() throws SQLException
      updateBalance method which updates your currency balance with the help of methods FinanceControlModel.getBalance() and FinanceControlModel.getCurrencyState()
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is error connected with a database access
